summary: The bill, titled the Cybersecurity for Rural Water Systems Act, aims to amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It establishes a cybersecurity circuit rider program to provide technical assistance to rural water and wastewater systems. This program will offer assessments of cybersecurity capabilities, help develop protection protocols, address inadequate cyber protection plans, and document the state of cyber protection. The bill authorizes $10 million in appropriations for the program each year from 2025 to 2029.
